title: Enacts a comprehensive complaint review procedure for the New York city water board
summary: Enacts a comprehensive complaint review procedure for the New York city water board in its processing of grievances brought by water and sewer customers, including the imposition of time limitations and further review by an independent administrative law judge.

       AN  ACT  to  amend  the public authorities law, in relation to complaint
         procedures for grievances before the New York city water board

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Subdivision 4 of section 1045-g of the public authorities
    2  law, as amended by chapter 467 of the laws of 2001, is amended  to  read
    3  as follows:
    4    4.  To  establish,  fix,  revise,  charge  and collect and enforce the
    5  payment of all fees, rates, rents and other service charges for the  use
    6  of, or services furnished by the sewerage system, water system, or both,
    7  as the case may be, so as to receive revenues which, together with other
    8  revenues available to the board, if any, shall be at least sufficient at
    9  all  times so that such system or systems shall be placed on a self-sus-
   10  taining basis in accordance with section one  thousand  forty-five-j  of
   11  this title; provided, however that the water board shall not establish a
   12  limit  of  less than four years commencing from the date of the bill for
   13  services to challenge any fee, rate, rent or other service  charges  for
   14  the  use  of or services furnished by the water and/or sewerage systems;
   15  any such challenge shall specifically  set  forth  the  basis  for  such
   16  claim;  AND PROVIDED FURTHER, HOWEVER, THAT THE WATER BOARD SHALL ESTAB-
   17  LISH A WRITTEN PROCEDURE TO PROCESS CUSTOMER COMPLAINTS WHICH ALLOW  FOR
   18  THE  ACCEPTANCE  AND  PROCESSING OF COMPLAINTS WITHIN TEN CALENDAR DAYS.
   19  SUCH PROCEDURE SHALL REQUIRE THAT  COMPLAINTS  BE  ACKNOWLEDGED  BY  THE
   20  BOARD  WITHIN  THREE  CALENDAR  DAYS,  BE PROMPTLY INVESTIGATED, AND THE
   21  RESULTS OF SUCH INVESTIGATION BE REPORTED TO THE CUSTOMER IN  PLAIN  AND
   22  COMPREHENSIBLE LANGUAGE. UPON EXHAUSTION OF ALL COMPLAINT PROCEDURES, OR
   23  AFTER  THIRTY DAYS IF THE WATER BOARD FAILS TO RESPOND TO THE COMPLAINT,

   45    8. The water board shall prepare and transmit to the city on or before
   46  the first day of December in each year a list of those persons or  prop-

   48  rates, rents or other charges for a period of sixty days or  more  after

   54  the  same  and  the  amounts chargeable to each, including penalties and
   55  interest computed to the next succeeding December thirty-first. The city
   56  shall levy such sums against the properties liable and shall  state  the

    1  amount thereof in a separate column in the annual tax rolls of such city

    3  charges" or "delinquent water and sewerage charges" as may be  appropri-

   10    S 3. Section 1045-y of the public authorities law, as amended by chap-
   11  ter 514 of the laws of 1984, is amended to read as follows:
   12    S  1045-y.  Audit and annual report. The accounts of the authority and
   13  the water board shall be subject to the supervision of  the  city  comp-
   14  troller.  The authority and the water board shall annually submit to the
   15  mayor, the comptroller and the  director  of  management  and  budget  a
   16  detailed  report.    THE REPORT SHALL INCLUDE A RECORD OF ALL COMPLAINTS
   17  RECEIVED FOR THE YEAR, WITH A DESCRIPTION OF THE NUMBER  AND  NATURE  OF

   19  PLANS TO REVISE PROCEDURES TO REDUCE THE PROBLEMS THAT GAVE RISE TO SUCH
   20  COMPLAINTS.  In  addition,  an  annual  audit  of the authority shall be
   21  conducted by an independent certified public  accountant.  Such  audited
   22  report shall be submitted to the mayor, the comptroller and the director
   23  of management and budget.
   24    S  4.  This  act shall take effect on the thirtieth day after it shall
   25  have become a law.
